subject: Re: [junit] Preventing JUnit from stopping on failures.
msgSnippet: ... A-men. -- J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger Diaspar Software Services http://www.diasparsoftware.com 2005 Gordon Pask Award Winner for contribution to Agile practice
messageBody:
David Jackman wrote:

> If unit tests are so expensive to run that
> you avoid it, then you really have bigger problems than just incomplete
> failure information.

A-men.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
Diaspar Software Services

2005 Gordon Pask Award Winner for contribution to Agile practice
